arts.ttl: Free-scoring VfB Stuttgart show grit to go with style
arts.sum: He got Stuttgart’s only goal in the game against Real Madrid, in which they were unlucky not to come away with a point, having held the European giants to a draw and outplayed them for much of the opening game of their Champions League campaign. Even if they didn’t have a dream start to their Bundesliga campaign, Sebastian Hoeneß’ free-scoring side are sat in eighth place, having hit 14 goals in five Bundesliga games, the second-best return in the league.

arts.ttl: Deniz Undav rescues point for VfB Stuttgart in Wolfsburg
arts.sum: The second half began with Stuttgart continuing to dominate possession, but the complexion of the match changed dramatically in the 63rd minute. Deniz Undav's 97th-minute equaliser rescued 10-man VfB Stuttgart a point in a dramatic 2-2 draw against Wolfsburg.

arts.ttl: 15:30 Kickoffs: Wolfsburg-Stuttgart ends in controversial draw, four teams earn clean sheet wins
arts.sum: A controversial match at the Volkswagen Arena on Sunday afternoon saw hosting VfL Wolfsburg and visiting VfB Stuttgart share the spoils in a 2-2 draw. Two other teams (RB Leipzig and FC St. Pauli) kept clean sheets against their respective opponents (FC Augsburg and SC Freiburg) in impressive victories. FC Heidenheim and Borussia Mönchengladbach also held their respective opponents (Mainz 05 and Union Berlin) to nil goals, but won more narrowly.

arts.ttl: Wolfsburg vs. Stuttgart preview: Die Wölfe face another tough test
arts.sum: Having already faced three of last season's top six, Wolfsburg will have to negotiate another tricky test when they play host to Stuttgart on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Preview: Wolfsburg vs. Stuttgart - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's Bundesliga clash between Wolfsburg and Stuttgart, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
